channel.title: cve.2021.1675 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in cve.2021.1675 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Possible PrintNightmare Print Driver Install
item.description: Detects the remote installation of a print driver which is possible indication of the exploitation of PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-1675). The occurrence of print drivers being installed remotely via RPC functions should be rare, as print drivers are normally installed locally and or through group policy.

item.title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation
item.description: Detects driver load events print service operational log that are a sign of successful exploitation attempts against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675

item.title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation Filename Pattern
item.description: Detects the default filename used in PoC code against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675

item.title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation IPC Access
item.description: Detects remote printer driver load from Detailed File Share in Security logs that are a sign of successful exploitation attempts against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527

item.title: Possible CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation
item.description: Detects events of driver load errors in print service logs that could be a sign of successful exploitation attempts of print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675

item.title: PrinterNightmare Mimimkatz Driver Name
item.description: Detects static QMS 810 and mimikatz driver name used by Mimikatz as exploited in CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527

item.title: Suspicious Printer Driver Empty Manufacturer
item.description: Detects a suspicious printer driver installation with an empty Manufacturer value

item.title: Windows Spooler Service Suspicious Binary Load
item.description: Detect DLL Load from Spooler Service backup folder

item.title: Windows Spooler Service Suspicious File Deletion
item.description: Detect DLL deletions from Spooler Service driver folder
